Email_help: Enter your email and we'll send you a link to reset your password
MobileNumber_help: Include the international country code and drop the leading 0 of your number, eg 61410123456
Name: Name
ClaimCodeInfo: To get your claim code go to the local UI of Agent and click on the server menu and Remote Access.
ClickEdit: Click the edit icon to add devices
CancelInfo: Warning: Please cancel your existing subscription first. Your subscription will still be valid up to it's expiry date:
Make_help: Start typing the camera manufacturer or model and select from available options
Channel_help: Usually only used by DVRs. Default is 0.
IPAddress_help: Examples: http://192.168.1.2:80, https://some.dyn.url:8082. Make sure your IP camera has a static IP address on your network.
ScanNetwork_help: Updates the list of network devices in the add camera wizard
AgentRestartPlugin: Warning: Agent DVR may restart. Access the plugin by editing the device.
PluginTrial: Extensions are free to try. Buy once and use on all your supported Agent DVR devices (desktop only)
UpdateAvailableHelp: Important: Backup your device configuration using the Server menu before updating.
PushAlerts_help: To use push alerts on mobile devices please install the Agent DVR app
AllowMedia: Recent browser updates require local device permissions to setup direct connections. Please grant permission to a local device. This won't be accessed.
RecordRawHelp: Saves CPU but larger file sizes and no overlays.
BrowserIncompatible: Please use a different web browser (we recommend Google Chrome)
FailedLocal: Could not connect. Is Agent DVR running?
SystemDisarmed: System Disarmed. Alerts are inactive. Click the logo to activate.

Configuration_help: Save this data to a local file to backup your configuration. To load, copy and paste the configuration in.
Configuration_help2: You can upload Agent or iSpy files here
EnableLater: See account menu to enable later
VideoIntro: Check out these quick videos to get started. Use the menu above to browse more help options. Open help at any time using .
VideoOutro: More help is available via the menu above or our User Guide.
Profiles_help: Profiles store which devices are switched on, have alerts enabled and have recording enabled. Configure your devices and add or edit a profile to save them. Click the tick button to apply a profile.
RunProfile_help: Click OK to save the current profile
WarningEmail: Email alerts have been rate limited

v.Suspended: Your account has been suspended. Please contact sean@ispyconnect.com for more information
v.FailureSendingEmail: Could not send email please send manually to sean@ispyconnect.com
v.AntiSpamFailed: Spam check failed. Please reload the web page
v.EnterMobile: Please enter your mobile number as you would dial it in your own country
v.UsernameShort: Username too short (must be greater than 3 characters)
v.PasswordShort: Password too short (must be greater than 3 characters)
v.InvalidTimezone: Please enter a valid timezone (number eg -5)
v.PasswordResetDisabled: Password reset is disabled for this account
v.IPBlocked: Your IP has been blocked (too many failed logins). Try later.

b.EnableNetworkDiscovery: Turn on Network Discovery in Network and Sharing Center and retry.

Sections.HTML:
The Agent DVR user interface is simple to use. Along the top of the screen you'll see a few icons

  • Agent DVR Icon - System alert status
  • - Manage your Server
  • - Change View
  • - Account Settings

The Agent DVR icon displays the main alerting status. A red icon means alerts are enabled. Click the icon to toggle.

The Server menu gives you quick options to edit devices, make changes to your server and other options.

The View menu lets you choose between live, timeline, recordings and photos (these are displayed as icons if there is enough space)

The Account menu lets you update your account settings, notification settings, subscription settings and general theme settings. There's also a logout option here (on the website)

The toolbar along the bottom displays when options are available.

To get started click the edit icon on the bottom right toolbar and add your cameras to Agent DVR. When you've added them click the edit button again and select the cameras to include on the grid.

Agent DVR supports various options like 'Column' and 'Detected' in addition to the grid view. The modes 'Detected' and 'Alerted' will only display cameras if they have recently detected or alerted. You can add up to 9 different grids with different camera layouts. Click the view icon to switch views. You can rename the view using the edit button.

To select a device in the grid just click on it. Click on it again to toggle full window mode. With a device selected controls are available on the toolbar to power on/off, edit the device, start/stop recording, take photos and trigger manual alerts. Files you generate with Agent DVR can be accessed using the View menu on the top toolbar.

Click on the PTZ icon to toggle the on-screen PTZ controller. You can also digital zoom into the camera using the mouse wheel or pinch gesture on touch devices and then pan around using touch or click and drag.

To re-arrange the grid click and drag a device into another device and they will swap places.

For more options like streaming to YouTube, talk, turning live audio on and off and pausing playback click the ellipsis icon .

The timeline displays your recordings on a zoomable, scrollable viewer. Use the mouse wheel, pinch gesture or zoom controls in the toolbar to zoom in and out and click/drag to move the timeline. Recordings are displayed as blocks of color you can click on to play the file. Gray blocks are recordings with little motion detected whereas red blocks have a lot of motion. If you zoom in far enough Agent DVR will add thumbnails to preview the recordings. You can search and filter the timeline by clicking on the search icon .

The recordings view displays a searchable summary of all the recordings Agent DVR has captured ordered by date and device.

Click on the min-max icon on a header to expand/collapse a device. Click on a thumbnail to playback a recording.

Click the edit icon to toggle edit mode. With edit mode selected clicking on the thumbnails will select them instead of playing them. With recordings selected use the tools on the bottom toolbar to either delete the recordings, download them (IOS doesn't support download unfortunately) or upload them to a cloud provider (setup the relevant cloud provider by editing the device). You can also queue up recordings by selecting them and clicking play on the toolbar.

Use the zoom controls to zoom in/ out of thumbnails.

Playback offers controls to speed up or slow down playback or tag the recording so it can be found using the search controls. Click the icon for options. You can also zoom into the playback using the mouse wheel or pinch gesture and click the photo button on the top toolbar to save the current frame.

Click the X at the top right of the playback window to return to the recordings view.

The photos view displays a searchable summary of all the photos Agent DVRhas captured ordered by date and device.

Click on the min-max icon on a header to expand/collapse a device. Click on a thumbnail to display a fullsize version.

Click the edit icon to toggle edit mode. With edit mode selected clicking on the thumbnails will select them instead of displaying them. With photos selected use the tools on the bottom toolbar to either delete the photos, download them (IOS doesn't support download unfortunately) or upload them to a cloud provider (setup the relevant cloud provider by editing the device).

Use the zoom controls to zoom in/ out of thumbnails.

• The local client is only accessible from localhost. This is because only localhost can bypass the SSL requirements. To work around this you need to use the ispyconnect web user interface instead (as it has a valid SSL certificate).
  • USB camera isn't working: Only one application can generally use a USB camera at a time. Please ensure no other apps are using the camera.
  • To use the desktop as a video source Agent DVR needs to run under a local account. To do this, stop the Agent service and run Agent DVR as a console application instead.
  • Some browsers don't display images on desktop alert notifications. Use google chrome for the best experience.
  • Recordings don't playback: Change the recording mode on the camera to Software instead of Raw.

To interface Agent with IOT devices you can use MQTT. To set this up enter your MQTT Server details in your server settings. You can then set alert actions on your devices to use MQTT to post messages to topics. The system also listens to incoming messages on the topic Agent/commands and responds on Agent/responses. The commands are parsed by the local server. For example Agent can send a message via MQTT when it detects movement to trigger an outside service or your system can trigger Agent to record on a device by sending cmd=record&oid=1&ot=2; to Agent/commands

PluginData.Gain_desc: Adds an equalizer for any audio source
